phrases.text: Lẳng lặng nghe tôi phong ống
phrases.english: (name: Lẳng) silent listen/hear I/subject wind tube

culturalContext.description: As the opening phrase, this establishes the song's emotional tone and invites audience engagement.
facts: Northern Vietnamese music is characterized by refined, softer dynamics, high tessitura
Opening phrases in Vietnamese folk songs often use vocatives (ơi, này) to grab attention before the narrative begins
Vietnamese musical phrases typically follow speech tone patterns - rising tones matched with rising pitches
The pentatonic scale (5-note) is fundamental to Vietnamese folk music, avoiding Western semitone tensions
culturalContext.musicalContext: The 6-syllable structure (song lục) balances melody with text, common in Southern traditions. As the opening phrase, it establishes the tonal center and introduces the melodic motif that will be varied throughout.

phrases.text: Thánh triều lồng lộng lên ngự ngai vàng
phrases.english: (name: Thánh) triều [?] cage lộng [?] go up ngự [?] ngai [?] yellow

culturalContext.description: This narrative phrase contributes to the song's narrative structure and emotional arc, typical of Northern folk traditions.
facts: Northern Vietnamese music is characterized by refined, softer dynamics, high tessitura
Vietnamese musical phrases typically follow speech tone patterns - rising tones matched with rising pitches
The pentatonic scale (5-note) is fundamental to Vietnamese folk music, avoiding Western semitone tensions
Đàn tranh (16-string zither) arrangements of folk songs are 20th century innovations - originals were vocal

phrases.text: Cố hữu hương hoa lên đền giáng phúc
phrases.english: Cố [?] hữu [?] incense/village flower go up đền [?] giáng [?] phúc [?]

culturalContext.description: Flowers ("hoa") are metaphors for young women and fleeting youth. Different flowers mark seasons: mai for Tết, lotus for summer, chrysanthemum for autumn.
facts: Northern Vietnamese music is characterized by refined, softer dynamics, high tessitura
Vietnamese musical phrases typically follow speech tone patterns - rising tones matched with rising pitches
The pentatonic scale (5-note) is fundamental to Vietnamese folk music, avoiding Western semitone tensions
Đàn tranh (16-string zither) arrangements of folk songs are 20th century innovations - originals were vocal
culturalContext.musicalContext: Positioned at the song's midpoint, this phrase likely marks a structural pivot or climax in the narrative.

phrases.text: Ấy nhời tôi chúc là nhời tôi phong
phrases.english: that nhời [?] I/subject wish is/be nhời [?] I/subject wind

phrases.text: Ấy giông giông giông cái giông tầm tập
phrases.english: that storm/wind storm/wind storm/wind classifier storm/wind reach/level practice/volume

culturalContext.description: "Ông" is a respectful address for married men. Its use in this context shows the formal politeness maintained in Vietnamese, even when criticizing one's husband.
facts: Vietnamese has rich onomatopoeia: each sound word can indicate size, intensity, texture
Sound words like "tẹo tèo teo" use vowel gradation (ẹ→è→e) to suggest diminishing size
Northern Vietnamese music is characterized by refined, softer dynamics, high tessitura
Vietnamese musical phrases typically follow speech tone patterns - rising tones matched with rising pitches

phrases.text: Giông tầm giông tập giông tập tầm giông
phrases.english: storm/wind reach/level storm/wind practice/volume storm/wind practice/volume reach/level storm/wind

culturalContext.description: "Ông" is a respectful address for married men. Its use in this context shows the formal politeness maintained in Vietnamese, even when criticizing one's husband. As the closing phrase, this provides resolution and often returns to opening themes for circular structure.
facts: Vietnamese has rich onomatopoeia: each sound word can indicate size, intensity, texture
Sound words like "tẹo tèo teo" use vowel gradation (ẹ→è→e) to suggest diminishing size
Northern Vietnamese music is characterized by refined, softer dynamics, high tessitura
Vietnamese musical phrases typically follow speech tone patterns - rising tones matched with rising pitches
culturalContext.musicalContext: As the closing phrase, it typically returns to the tonic note and may quote the opening melody for circular structure.
